channel.title: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?
channel.description: My dad bought halve of my laptop cause it was expensive. Anyways, screw vista. Its giving crap, and its lagging me. Any ideas how i could convice my parents to go linux? And WINE is a windows app am i correct?

item.title: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?
item.dc:creator: @fluffymuff1n fluffymuff1n
item.description:
@fluffymuff1n wrote:

could i still run cod4 on linux?

Read full topic

item.title: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?
item.dc:creator: @arr0w Arr0w
item.description:
@arr0w wrote:

[quote=“fluffymuff1n, post:3, topic:183108”][quote author=Rajae link=topic=244806.msg2066459#msg2066459 date=1203492665]
If he says no then just go XP.
[/quote]
they deny that too.[/quote]
I doubt they’d tell the difference if you just got the Vista Start Bar.

Read full topic
item.source: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?

item.title: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Cryme Time:

DO not do IT!. The average retard like me could fuck up anything, Ubuntu ruined my computer and when i went to my dad for help and asked why i attempted but failed to install linux, he said this “(name), linux is for geeks.” and i was like truedat. So he installed his old Windows XP Pro. SP1 Repair disk onto my computer, but now i have NO drivers so i cannot do anything, i am surviving off of a Ubuntu LIVE CD. IT SUCKS ASS, stay with windows.

Wow, you kknow half of this forum prefers linux and you just called it horrible? How hard is it to boot the live cd and run an installer, set the swap drive and main drive, format, install. only problem I ever had was internet cause my card is shit for linux, damn you dell… well yea, with the new ubuntu releases even my internet works fine now.

Read full topic
item.source: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?

item.title: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?

item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

You can dual ubuntu so just tell them they can choose vista when they start.

item.source: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?

item.title: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:183108”][quote author=Cryme Time link=topic=244806.msg2066661#msg2066661 date=1203495982]
DO not do IT!. The average retard like me could fuck up anything, Ubuntu ruined my computer and when i went to my dad for help and asked why i attempted but failed to install linux, he said this “(name), linux is for geeks.” and i was like truedat. So he installed his old Windows XP Pro. SP1 Repair disk onto my computer, but now i have NO drivers so i cannot do anything, i am surviving off of a Ubuntu LIVE CD. IT SUCKS ASS, stay with windows.
[/quote]

It’s almost impossible to destroy your computer with software. You did not “ruin” your computer.

(I’d say impossible, but some smartass would point out obscurities such as giving old monitors synch rates outside their capabilities and blowing them… that said, I’ve done this :()

Your dad sounds like a total tit to be honest.[/quote]

did you just call my father a nipple?

Read full topic

item.title: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

If you do do it then make sure all the hardware, drivers etc can be installed, My dad tried redhat and it didn’t wanna do anything, no drivers could be installed heck after 3 reboots he had to put xp back on… And hes the one you will find trying to prove theres nothing wrong with linux…

Read full topic

item.title: Convincing parents to let me install linux on my laptop?
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

Run a program that starts up all the time that makes the CPU work 100% all the time. He will start to think about changing due to vista being extremely slow. You could just wait a couple months for it to really slow down though, no need for a program.
